Package monsterfighter.core

Class GameEnvironment

java.lang.Object
monsterfighter.core.GameEnvironment
public class GameEnvironment extends Object
Manages the Monster Fighter application.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Class

  • Field Details

    • MAX_DAYS

      public static final int MAX_DAYS
      The maximum number of days that a game can last.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • MIN_DAYS

      public static final int MIN_DAYS
      The minimum number of days that a game can last.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

  • Constructor Details

    • GameEnvironment

      public GameEnvironment(GameEnvironmentUi ui, List<Monster> monsters, List<Item> items)
      Constructs the GameEnvironment that will interact with the user interface and call the core classes.
      Parameters:
      ui - The user interface that the game will run with
      monsters - The Monster's that will populate the game
      items - The Item's that will populate the game

  • Method Details

    • start

      public void start()
      Starts the game. Must be called from the event dispatch thread (EDT) if the user interface is a Swing gui. This method calls GameEnvironmentUi.setup(GameEnvironment) to initiate setup of the user interface. Method adapted from the seng201 RocketManager example project.

    • onSetupFinished

      public void onSetupFinished(String name, int totalDays, Monster startingMonster, String nickname, GameEnvironment.Difficulty difficulty)
      This method should be called by the user interface when GameEnvironmentUi.setup(GameEnvironment) has been completed. This method calls GameEnvironmentUi.start() to tell the user interface to start. Method adapted from the seng201 RocketManager example project.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the Player
      totalDays - The total number of days that the game can run for
      startingMonster - The starting Monster that the user chose
      nickname - The nickname that the user chose for their starting Monster
      difficulty - The chosen difficulty for the game

    • onFinish

      public void onFinish()
      This method should be called by the GameEnvironmentUi when the user has requested to quit the application. This method calls GameEnvironmentUi.quit() after first confirming the user really wants to quit. Method adapted from the seng201 RocketManager example project.

    • transitionScreen

      public void transitionScreen(String destination, String back)
      Calls the Gui.transitionScreen(String, String) method if a screen transition is requested.
      Parameters:
      destination - A string representation of the screen that is being transitioned to
      back - A string representation of the screen that is transitioned to by a screen's back button

    • getPlayer

      public Player getPlayer()
      Gets the Player.
      Returns:
      The Player

    • getShop

      public Shop getShop()
      Gets the Shop.
      Returns:
      The Shop

    • getBattles

      public Battles getBattles()
      Gets the Battles.
      Returns:
      The Battles

    • getTotalDays

      public int getTotalDays()
      Gets the total number of days that the game may run for.
      Returns:
      The total number of days

    • getDay

      public int getDay()
      Gets the current day that the game is on.
      Returns:
      The current day

    • getDifficulty

      public GameEnvironment.Difficulty getDifficulty()
      Gets the difficulty chosen by the user.
      Returns:
      The chosen difficulty

    • getRandomEvent

      public RandomEvent getRandomEvent()
      Gets the RandomEvents that occur after the user rests.
      Returns:
      The RandomEvents

    • getBattleRunning

      public boolean getBattleRunning()
      Gets a boolean that signals whether a battle is running.
      Returns:
      True if the user is in a battle and false otherwise

    • getAllMonsters

      public List<Monster> getAllMonsters()
      Gets all the Monster's that populate the game environment.
      Returns:
      An unmodifiable list of all Monster's

    • getAllItems

      public List<Item> getAllItems()
      Gets all the Item's that populate the game environment.
      Returns:
      An unmodifiable list of all Item's

    • getStartingMonsters

      public List<Monster> getStartingMonsters()
      Gets the list of starting Monster's that the user can choose from.
      Returns:
      An unmodifiable list of the starting Monster's

    • getInventoryUI

      public List<ArrayList<Item>> getInventoryUI()
      Creates and returns a copy of the Player's inventory that contains lists of size > 0. Used in the UI to display only existing items.
      Returns:
      An unmodifiable list of lists containing Item's derived from the Player's inventory

    • getSelectedObject

      public Object getSelectedObject()
      Gets the item or monster that is being handled by the UI.
      Returns:
      An object of type Purchasable

    • setSelectedObject

      public void setSelectedObject(Purchasable selectedObject)
      Sets the selected object. The Object must extend the Purchasable interface, such as Monster or Item.
      Parameters:
      selectedObject - An object that extends the Purchasable interface

    • switchMonsters

      public void switchMonsters(Monster monster, Monster monsterSwitch)
      Switches Monster's in the Player's party.
      Parameters:
      monster - The Monster being switched
      monsterSwitch - The Monster being switched with.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if a battle is running and the user tries to switch in a fainted monster

    • useItem

      public void useItem(Monster monster, Item item)
      Uses a given Item on a given Monster.
      Parameters:
      monster - The Monster that will an Item used on it
      item - The Item that will be used on the Monster and then removed from the Player's inventory

    • sellItem

      public void sellItem(Item item)
      Sells an item from the Player's inventory.
      Parameters:
      item - The item to be sold

    • sellMonster

      public void sellMonster(Monster monster)
      Sells a monster from the Player's party
      Parameters:
      monster - The monster to be sold

    • purchase

      public void purchase(Purchasable object)
      Purchases a Monster or Item from the shop.
      Parameters:
      object - The monster or item that is to be purchased.

    • nextDay

      public void nextDay()
      Goes to the next day, fully heals the players monsters, refreshes the available battles, refills the shop and handles any random events that may occur

    • startBattle

      public void startBattle()
      Attempts to start a battle if the player's party has any monsters that are conscious. Throws an error otherwise.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if there are no monsters in the players party that can fight

    • manageBattle

      public void manageBattle(Battle opponent)
      Manages the battle after the player has their turn.
      Parameters:
      opponent - The battle that the player is fighting

    • opponentTurn

      public void opponentTurn(Battle opponent)
      Decides what the opponent's next move is and manages it.
      Parameters:
      opponent - The battle that the player is fighting

    • rewards

      public void rewards(Battle opponent)
      Gives the player their rewards from the battle
      Parameters:
      opponent - The battle that the player fought against
